Review Text: A very good place to visit as part of the visit to Kandy. We used the electric cart for  Lkr 2000 which was worthwhile as the driver was very knowledgeable about the flora and the history. Downside is the poor toilet facilities ( donot even go near them) lack of proper parking facilities.
Ripping off the tourists as it is the norm everywhere in SL. Not worth Rs3000 but good vfm for the locals.  Wouldn't recommend

Lovely gardens, very well maintained, enjoyable few hours, worth going to have a wander (a few monkey's there too). We stayed at Hanthana House just outside of Kandy which was fabulous and their driver took us on a tour of Kandy which included here.

A tranquil place after all the noise from traffic. Lovely gardens, especially the number of different trees. Orchids were good, but a small display, we are used to the orchid garden in Singapore, which I reckon must be the best in the world.

Botanical Gardens of Peradeniya - 147 acres in extent, this is the best and the largest garden in Sri Lanka that a visitor to Kandy should never miss. Created in the 14th Century as the Pleasure Garden of Kandyan Kings, the Royal Botanical Gardens of Peradeniya is surrounded by the river Mahaweli on three sides and is connected to the opposite bank by a suspension bridge. With more than 4000 species of flora, the garden is an example of the wealth and beauty of the tropics. With more than hundred varieties of palm trees, five palm avenues where palms such as Talipot grow to an immense size, wonderful arches of glossy foliage, lovely fernery, and orchid houses with rare blossoms and spice trees in groves make it a rich botanical heritage in the world.

A great place to visit, interesting trees, flying foxes, according to the guide 24,000 of them, a lake, an orchid house and just a really peaceful place to stroll. We could have spent longer here but really enjoyed the visit. If you in Kandy it is a must. Entrance is 1500 rupees.

Beautifully landscaped and well maintained botanical garden with many species of bamboo and tropical trees. Lovely to walk around in for an hour. Squirrels, monkeys and bats watching. And to the young Sri Lankese couples in love who sit here together on a bench. Perhaps because they have no privacy anywhere else. People who whinge that you have to pay entrance and much more than the locals, I recommend staying home. By Dutch standards the entrance is very reasonable.
Not so much things to do in Kandy, but this park  botanical garden it's a must! Absolutely impressive, for a nature lover is astonishing to see those giant trees! Good gardening, very instagramable!

the staff working at the ticket counter were extremely rude and unhelpful to us, arguing with us over the price of a ticket for my wife, who holds Residence visa in Sri Lanka, demanding for us to change our local tickets for tourist. would not return here.

Not somewhere we would normally go but had a spare afternoon and made a visit. Very glad we did, beautiful and extensive gardens full of extraordinary trees and specimens. Need at least a couple of hours to explore - suspension bridge over the river, fruit bats flying about and hanging down/dripping from the trees for the night, fascinating canon ball tree and many more surprises.

We were taken to the gardens by our guide ‚ÄòObama‚Äô. It was a beautiful and relaxing place to visit, except the bangers being set of to scare the fruit bats off! We really enjoyed our time there. The orchid house, the avenue of palms and all the different examples of plants and trees were well worth the visit. We both would definitely like to visit the gardens again.

We visited the Royal Botanical Gardens with friends and thoroughly enjoyed another walk through the beautiful gardens. There is always something new to see every time we go there, including the area of trees planted by famous visitors - King Edward VII and Czar Nicholas II for example.

Beautiful gardens just outside of the town, quite large well laid out and easy to navigate , lots of unusual plants and trees with a large poulation of fruit bats at the top end of the gardens. Well worth a trip and easy to spend 3 or 4 hours here. Nice orchid house and a variety of animal and bird life.
Good variety of flora. Entrance fees on a higher side 1500 LKR otherwise worth visiting and great place to visit especially in the afternoons.

this botanical garden is said to be the garden used by the last king of kandy to meet his queen and stroll which was later improved by the British. a highlight of this garden is the orchid museum which has many varieties of orchid flowers.
It was great to spend a few hours wandering around the gardens. There were a number of school groups at the gardens when i visited and one group took great delight in meeting me and having selfies.

We were on a day tour from the Cinnamon Grand to the Elephant Orphanage and Temple of the Tooth and our guide, Nishantha, suggested visiting the gardens. They were stunning. Unlike NZ and the UK there is no need for glasshouses and we saw many beautiful and imposing plants. The age of the trees is impressive as it is an old park (1371AD). The Great Circle was really interesting as dignitaries over the last 150 years have been planting trees. There was a riot of colour in places, awesome avenues and gigantic bamboos. The gardens are huge (147 acres) and  we would recommend paying 250 rupees (2 NZ$) extra and taking the shuttle tour if you only have limited time. You could easily spend a day here and it was a romantic spot for couples.

Ok but not great. There are many huge trees, but not enough flowers or colorful shrubs imo. The place is big enough for kids to run around. But they mainly liked the squirrels and monkeys that we found, trees did not catch our attention too much mostly.

Botanical garden is located approx. 5.5 km before the Kandy city center bordering Mahaweli river. A historical park dated back to 1371 has over 4000 species of plants including some endemic ones to Sri Lanka. Loved exploring rose and orchid gardens but, felt orchid varieties were not enough. But whatever available wad not disappointing. Enjoyed Walking along the two palm avenues and cabbage avenue. There are more avenues, but couldn't try them all. Entire park is approx. 147 acre which may take 1/2 day to cover.

This centuries old botanical garden planned by the British in the centre of the hill station Kandy, Sri Lanka is huge. There are a number of covered exhibits category wise like seasonal flowers, cactus, perennial et al., The place is well maintained and the pathways are clean. A number of families picnicking in the park are also mindful of the trash they generate and are meticulous in keeping the area clean. There are a number of species of plants and trees which are imported from across the world and are thriving in the botanical garden. One needs atleast a couple of hours to walk around the garden and enjoy the nature. The entry fee to the garden is reasonable and the park is secured fully by barbed wire fencing. The security checks at the entrance are robust. Take your camera along. Recommended.
The gardens are really worth the visit, I was shocked how much I enjoyed it. You need at least an hour

Well-maintained park, nice flora (plants / trees / flowers) with some cute fauna around. It's pretty and spacious, and nice for a walk on a fine day, but nothing too special, if you compare it with all the other botanical gardens that lots of countries also have. Or maybe the hoards of flying foxes around are pretty special, if you ask me. They were all flying around in the skies, looking for a spot to rest amongst the tall trees. I'm not sure if that's a seasonal sight, but I saw them when I visited in March. However for them to be collecting entrance fees for it seems a bit of a money-sucking move. If I were to do away with any humility here, you're welcome to visit my country's botanical gardens. Singapore's Botanic Gardens is bigger, prettier, UNESCO-listed, and free to enter. Just sayin'.

We visited the Botanical gardens in Kandy yesterday morning. We hired the golf buggy for one hour and were taken around the gardens by a guide who was very informative. We stopped and looked whenever we wanted to which was good. One of our group walked around but couldn't see all the gardens in that time therefore missed out on certain parts of the garden. We were short on time and apparently you need four hours to walk around the whole gardens. They are certainly worth a look at even if you don't have four hours. There is also a bus which takes about ten people.

I enjoyed visiting this well marked botanical garden. Many varieties of plants and native trees here. There are some interesting palms and it‚Äôs nice walking around. I could only spend an hour but one could easily spend more time relaxing in the lawns. It‚Äôs right next to the river.

Could have spent a whole day in the Garden as it is just gorgeous. The Garden takes up 147 acres with over 4,000 species. Lots of walking around but I did see a trolley bus. The garden has different areas including the Orchid House, Great Lawn, Lake, Spice Garden (reached via a suspension bridge), Flower Garden and Palm Avenue to name a few all with magnificent plant specimens. It will take a few hours but when you're tired you can sit down on beautiful manicured lawn and rest a while. There's a busy cafe near the Great Lawn but toilets are few and far between.

We took side entrance using suspension bridge, which was fantastic. At the end of it number of monkeys ‚Äúwelcomed‚Äù us. You should be careful though as they are far for being innocent. The botanical garden is a must see in Kandy. It‚Äôs calm and relaxing and you can walk around as there is plenty shadow provided by some amazing trees. Entrance fee for 2 adults and 2 children is 4500 Rs.

We spent 2 hours here on the way from Kandy to Nuwara Eliya, enjoyed it very much and would recommend a visit.  Be prepared though for not much information in english or labelling of the plants and trees

Very boring place in Kandy. It‚Äôs a normal garden for most of the people, however it is heaven for plant lovers as they can find variety of trees and flowers over here. Nothing to do here and you will find lots of local couples romancing behind the trees. Also you will find lots of local school students coming for a day picnic here. Fees is too high for visitors which 3000 Rs for a couple. Entry to a garden with nothing to do is very high. Moreover there are buggies operating in the garden but again at a very high cost and their availability is very low. You will have to wait a lot for your turn. Not a worthy place to visit! Avoid if you can!

Well worth going and spending half day here. There are less flowers in the gardens than I expected and the gardens are dominated by large trees, with some particularly impressive specimens. There are also large collections of Bamboo and palms. There is also a reasonably nice orchid house. I think I was most impressed by the large number of flying foxes (bats) that roost in the trees in the corner near the suspension bridge. There are thousands, and the information board says 24k which I can believe. They make quite a racket, and you do see quite a number flying around which is impressive as they are huge. One minor critism is that there were too few benches, and those that were available were always occupied by courting couples, it seems to be where they come. Overall a great place to spend a few hours, although not in the same league as other  botantical gardens such as the one in Singapore which is a lot bigger with a vastly superior collection of orchids.

I visited here in December. The weather was nice and the gardens were beautiful! There were a wide variety of vegetation, including lots of tall trees, and very pretty plants. There were also lots of monkeys chilling around the place. There are bats too, you can hear them up in the trees. They are big bats, but I was told they are vegetarians. The grounds had lots of families and couples hanging about but it def did not feel crowded. There are bathrooms in the garden and they seem sanitary. Highly recommend!

Really nice vast garden lots of interesting trees from all over the world. The garden is home to 24,000 bats which can be seen hanging from the trees, breathtaking. There are  also monkeys in the garden as well as a suspension bridge over a river which can be walked on. There is a lovely buffet that can be had for lunch as well.

We went to the Botanical Gardens as part of a two day trip organised by Sam Sampath, Big Brother Tours. Sam had organised a cart and a guide to take us round and I was glad that he did. There is so much to see and a huge area to cover, we learned so much from our guide that we would otherwise never know. The flora is beautiful and the gardens very well maintained. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would recommend.

We loved exploring the beautiful grounds of the garden and only wish we'd had longer there. We arrived mid afternoon with our young children who adored the space to runaround and explore. They spent time looking at the different flora and fauna and admiring sights and sounds of the birds and numerous bats. We had been told there was a chance of seeing monkeys but were overwhelmed to observe them closely on the suspension ('dancing bridge'). We had a truly fabulous time visiting and would recommend it to everyone.
It's really worth visiting these gardens and don't skimp on time as there's a lot to see. It's beautifully laid out and well signposted.

This place really is a gem and oh so beautiful but again foreigners will pay for the fact that they are foreigners. Effective August, 5 (we visited on the 6thüôà) the entrance fee was increased to 2000 Rupies. Still this place is worth a visit. Make sure to bring some time and enjoy the beauty of the park. There is lots to see and also enough spaces to rest. If this is not convincing you, just take a look at the pictures.

A bit west of Kandy in Peradeniya lies this very popular site. It is spread over 147 acres or nearly .6 square kilometers. More than 4,000 species of plants, spices, palm trees and medicinal plants can be found here. It is a place for solitude, especially if you have come from the Temple of the Tooth. There are several avenues of note, including the Avenue of Palms. The Orchid House is visually stunning.
This Garden was huge with lots of plants and tree but it was not as i expected from a Royal Garden. it was not a real organized Royal Garden

In Royal Botanical Gardens, you can see another view of Sydney Opera and Sydney Bridge. The view is good, air is flash, you can see sydney people relax life style. Also, Mrs Macquarie‚Äôs Chair is in it and worth to see.

Its a beautiful and well-organised garden, with some impressive trees. We were there around 2pm and walked for 2.5 hrs. Alot of shade and a good constant breeze kept us cool. We saw lots of squirrels, monkeys, lizards and a few interesting birds. The kids were pretty excited about spotting these. We also took lots of photos and making silly poses. All the trees and shrubs were impressive, and very interesting. The gardens were well kept and quite beautiful, looking like a scene from an European garden. Great walk after lunch and great family bonding too!

One of the oldest botanical gardens in the world.  Our guide around the gardens was the botanist Bandara Palipana and he made it a most interesting tour.  We saw many trees and shrubs which were new to us and the stories behind some of the plantings was interesting.  The orchis collection has over 300 varieties on show.  The Cook pine (introduced from New Caledonia by Captain Cook) is unusual as always leans towards the equator.   HM Queen Elizabeth II, Lord Mountbatten, King George IV, Yuri Gagarin and others have planted trees there.  Lord Mountbatten used the old residence in the centre f the park as his headquarters as Supreme Allied Commander of South East Asia Command during WWII.  The gardens are kept in a pristine condition.  Many Bollywood films have used it for location shooting.

Review Title: A Peaceful Nature Escape Near Kandy
Review Text: Just 15 minutes from Kandy city, the Royal Botanic Gardens, Peradeniya is a must-visit for anyone who loves nature, photography, or simply a peaceful stroll. The gardens are huge and beautifully maintained, with over 4,000 plant species from around the world. My favourites were the colourful Orchid House, the impressive avenue of Royal Palms, and the massive Javan fig tree which is truly a wonder to see. It‚Äôs a very calm and relaxing place, with plenty of benches to sit and take in the scenery. You can easily spend 2‚Äì3 hours wandering here. Tip: Visit in the morning or late afternoon for softer light and fewer crowds. Wear comfortable shoes as the gardens are quite big, and bring your camera ‚Äî every corner is a photo opportunity!
Visited here while on a tour of Sri Lanka.  What an oasis of calm and tranquility!  Some very impressive tree lined avenues and many fabulous specimen trees.

We visited Peradeniya Botanical Gardens in April with our family, and it was truly one of the highlights of our trip to Kandy. The gardens are vast, beautifully maintained, and offer a perfect blend of natural beauty and tranquility. Walking through the towering palm avenues, orchid house, and spice gardens was a relaxing and enriching experience. The sheer variety of flora was impressive, and the kids especially enjoyed the giant bamboo and the massive Javan fig tree. The weather in April was warm but pleasant, and there were plenty of shaded areas to rest. We packed some snacks and had a lovely little picnic on the grass. It‚Äôs also a great spot for photography‚Äîevery corner has something unique to offer. Highly recommend this place for families, nature lovers, or anyone looking to spend a peaceful day outdoors. Give yourself at least 2‚Äì3 hours to explore fully. Tip: Wear comfortable shoes, bring water, and try to visit early in the morning or late afternoon to avoid the midday heat.

Arrived here with our guide and had a lovely walk around the gardens, wild monkeys roam around the gardens and provide some entertainment. There is also a large number of fly foxes who hang out in the trees down by the river who made a really loud squeaking noise. The gardens are beautiful and particularly liked the orchid displays

This is a must see in Kandy. There is a big variety of plants and what impressed me the most was that not only is the names of the plants/trees shown, but also the country of origin. We spend about 3 hours there but if you have time you can spend the whole day. The layout is also good and interesting in some instances.

There are better botanical displays elsewhere in the world. Even Kew Gardens in the UK is better. It‚Äôs a shame really as they have a good climate here for things to flourish well. It‚Äôs something to do whilst in Kandy, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone coming to Sri Lanka.
If you're travelling to Kandy, visiting these gardens is a must. They are beautiful. A nature-lovers dream.

Fabulous botanical gardens, very well maintained and a must see when visiting Kandy. The variety of trees, plants and fauna are amazing, we followed the path along the river and came to the suspension bridge at the top, then made our way back towards the orchid house. Approx an hour and a half.

Beautiful gardens, very well kept, not cheap tickets, but worth the price if you are interested in trees, that are the main attraction. The orchid glasshouse was a bit of a delusion because there weren‚Äôt any particular varieties.

The Royal Botanical Garden in Peradeniya, Kandy, is one of the most desirable places on the island. It is home to more than 13,000 different species of plants, some unique to the island itself. A place to truly desire mother nature and to spend quality time with your loved ones

Make sure you have set aside at least two hours - there is a lot to see and considerable ground to cover.  A guide is not essential and though you will see sights familiar from home there are also exceptionally rare plants and flowers, all in perfect condition and set against majestic lawns and avenues of elegant palms.  There is a photo opportunity at every juncture.  Simply stunning and well worth the modest entrance fee.
Excellent visit with a private guide extremely knowledgeable and interesting. It is a must when in Kandy. When in the garden must visit the orchard house, well presented with many species.
Every time we go anywhere near Kandy we visit the Royal Botanical Gardens at Peradeniya and spend an hour walking through them. As usual and as expected, they were excellent.

You don't have to be a dedicated gardener to enjoy these gardens. Trees are labelled according to whether they're native, imports, even poisonous- so don't lick these ones! We had our guide with us, and he had a lot of knowledge about some of the plants and trees, that we may have missed if we'd been by ourselves. The mahogany trees are spectacular- the root system is about a metre high. The Cannonball tree looks like it has coconuts, but they weigh about 4kg. The palm trees lining one path are huge, and the little ones in between them are the same type, but look different when they're younger. We saw flying foxes, a water monitor, birdlife, and there's an orchid house, and a small suspension bridge. We were here a few hours, and it was a very pleasant visit. Well recommended.
These gardens are fabulous, beautifully laid out and well kept. Wonderful variety of plants, and saw monkeys playing in the giant bamboo. Well worth the visit. Quiet and peaceful.
Had a good walk through the gardens. There are several unique plants in the garden. The orchids were OK but there were not as many that I heard about.

The Botanical Gardens are definitely one of the highlights of a stay in Kandy.   If you are short of time take a 1 hour tour in a golf buggy with a local guide (1000 rupees) The guy we had was incredibly knowledgeable and showed us all sorts of plants and birds that we would have probably missed by just walking around on our own.   The fruit bats high up in the tree tops are fascinating.  Many of the wonderful trees have been planted by visiting dignitaries and our guide knew the date everyone was planted.

This garden was a welcome stop after hours of transport and tumult amid the noise of Kandy. A remarkable vestige of the British era, perfectly maintained, with beautiful discoveries. An impression of order and tranquility that contrasts so much with what awaits you outside.

Loved this place! Great relaxing few hours spent here wandering around in theses fabulous gardens. There was lots of wildlife too including peacocks, monkeys and bats! Lots of areas of shade providing a welcome relief from the heat. Do check out the suspension beige too.

A wide range of plants many of which have been planted by dignitaries from all over the world. The orchids are spectacular. The whole area is well kept and is a great place to spend a relaxing afternoon.

One of the best maintained botanical gardens ever visited. If you are interested in the plant life scientifically , or just want to spend some good time in middle of best possible flora, this is the place to be. It's huge, so keep at least 3 hours to be spent here. Secondly, follow the map strictly, else u can easily lose track of places visited. Involves a lot of walking,  so not recommended for very young kids. They also have an option of hiring golf cart, but not sure about the prices.

The Royal Botanical Garden is a must visit when in Kandy, it is vast and offers plenty of shade on hot days, beautifully kept and looked after. An amazing range of plants and trees and just a very tranquil place to be, make sure to set aside a morning or afternoon as it‚Äôs not a quick visit or better still take a picnic and go for the day. Stunning.

We thoroughly enjoyed our day walking around these stunning gardens which are beautifully kept. Allow a good 3-4 hours to see everything. There are plenty of seating areas dotted around if you need a rest as well as some picnic areas and a restaurant.  We got caught in a tropical storm and used the time to have a lovely buffet lunch in the restaurant for a reasonable 950 rupees per person.  It was a very enjoyable day out.

We could have spent the whole day here. Such beautiful mature trees, palms, shrubs and flowers and so well kept. There are lots of shad d places to sit down in when you are a bit frazzled with the sun. It is worth going. My favourite was the memorial garden area with trees planted by past and present world leaders and famous figures from history. The flying foxes are also a must-see.

We visited this beautiful botanical garden on our way to Nuwara eliya from Kandy on a morning. It was very calming experience and got the chance to identify lot of new plants most of them native to Sri Lanka. it was a well maintained park where you can go and spend the time relaxingly. lot of space for children to run around and have fun. However, try to visit in a morning and on a less crowdy day.

I think this park is very beautiful place in our country ,the value here is high for several reasons .Things like  orchid house ,avenue of palms ,Bamboo collection ,cannonball tree ,herbal garden .lake ,memorial trees ,can be seen here .so enjoy the beauty here ,.

Well worth spending a couple of hours here as they are truly lovely. The orchid house is especially nice but the collections of bamboo, the herb garden but mainly the general fantastic layout of the garden. A must do while you are in Kandy
Beautiful place where you can choose to take your time and walk around or you can go on the mini buses and get off at whatever stops you want. Very nice if you have a spare hour or two.
superb gardens. very neat and clean and lots of walking paths. the views are pictuesque and the feel is very good. must visit place

I love the peace and tranquility of the Royal Botanical Gardens. The plants, Mameluke and birds help to create a haven of calm amidst the frantic hustle and bustle that is Sri Lankan traffic. For me a must visit. I read people complaining that foreigners pay more than locals. What a good idea, pity we don‚Äôt do that in the U.K.

A massive park with lots area to walk around for kids and to sit and relax,lots for types of trees and flowers and we'll maintained If you taking food and have it inside have to be careful with the monkeys
The gardens are well worth a visit! The orchid house is great and the gardens very peaceful. Expect to spend a good 4 or 5 hours exploring the beauty!
Great place to explore with kids. Nature at it‚Äôs best. Well maintained park with lush green park for children to play and explore different plants.

A beautifully kept garden with delights around every corner. Exotic flowers and towering trees. Near a busy  road and with a stream of people entering we were surprised to  find areas where we were alone and there was silence. 3000 Rupees to enter for foreigners. One can hire a golf buggy to be driven around if mobility is poor. We enjoyed the topiary hedges, there was a deserted maze, orchid house, rose garden and so much more we did not  have time to see. Many birds we haven‚Äôt seen anywhere else , monkeys, bats and a mongoose. Allow two to three hours. Toilets are dire.
kandy at its best nicely maintained one of the best places to visit for nature lovers. the restaurants need more quality & bit over priced for foreigners. have a paid buggy tour

Really beautiful park, with loads of of trees (some really uncommon), flowers and animals. Was able to spot a few animals, such as bats (in huge number), squirrels, snakes and birds. Probably the best attraction in Kandy area.

The entrance fee is expensive LKR2000 per person. There are many different species of of trees. They are beautifully line-up. There is also a section of plants planted and donated by foreign delegates. A indoor orchids orchard. Beware, there are a few trees full of bat's hanging and flying around. Go early as the sun climbs higher, it can get very hot.

It is a fantastic beautiful and well-maintained garden with a large number of different trees, palms, bushes and plants. There is also a lilies restaurant (Royal Botanical Cafeteria) that serves a small buffet but it is not the one you should visit the garden for.

It is unbelievable unless u read the pamphalet and check the dates...it is about 600+ years old garden and still maintained so well. Though they have Holf carts to take you around on nominal charges but the best way to explore this garden is buy walking around. Its not even difficult as there are benches arou d everywhere to sit and relax when u get tired. The river and the shaky bridge on it is really a great attraction in the park. A must visit site when in Srilanka.

Well worth a visit.  Huge garden to wander around and admire the vast and varied trees and plants in the garden all of which are well maintained.  Particularly impressed by the orchid house.  Added bonus are the monkeys and bats to add life to the garden.

Park is lovely and peacefull. Do not bother to order sri lankan omelette in cafeteria. U get only bland omelette with few bits of tomato. Asked about it from waitress. They just throwed me a loads of chili on different plate next to omelette. Been in Sri Lanka 1 month and this is definetly the Worst customer experience this far.

After a morning in the crazy streets of Kandy, it was lovely to get away from it all and visit the gardens. They are quite expansive and if you have a problem walking then there is a golf buggy type vehicle that goes around the gardens. I do not know how often they operate but the trip lasts about an hour. Best ask at ticket office. There is a cafe overlooking the expansive lawns about 5 minutes after the entrance and this is a good place to plan your route with the map provided as you enter. The soft drinks were reasonably priced 160 for a  Sprite and the cafe has some very clean bathrooms. The gardens are peaceful and whilst there are many more impressive botanical gardens around the world this is a pleasant way to spend couple of hours.

Peradeniya Royal Botanical Garden is located few kilometers away from Kandy city Sri Lanka. This ancient flower garden is home to authentic fauna and floras. You can get ralaxe at this calm environment.
You can easily spend the half day there. The exhibition has a high variety of local and global plants. We absolutely recommend to go there if you have time.

A visit to the Botanical Gardens should be at the top of your To Do list here in Kandy.  It‚Äôs worthwhile paying for a buggy ride around the Gardens as there is much to see and the guide will point out many things you might otherwise miss.  It‚Äôs also hot, so the breeze as you drive is refreshing.
Nice beautiful cool place in hot Sri Lankan hot weather. Natural cools air will full of oxyzen lot of flowers and trees

We could easily have spent all day here. Peaceful, quiet but beautiful. The variety of plants is amazing. Originally a royal pleasure garden  but laid out by the British in 1824. Look pout for the flying foxes!!

This is a must do in Kandy. Can easily spend 2-3 hours here just walking around and admiring the nature. Go in the morning as it is cooler and more pleasant to walk around. Do not miss the monkeys, fruit bats and suspension bridge. Really well kept - kudos to the managememt.

I was so impressed at every turn. This is a place not be missed. There are so many exotic species, endemic , native, and toxic species all color coded. I found wandering the outside regions instead of the orchid house more interesting personally. They had a large collection of cacti and succulents and incredible old huge trees. AN umbrella or at least a sun hat was important when we went. We had a trolley drive and stop so that we were able to cover more of the park. This is a wonderful place to spend several hours.

A well maintained garden , this place was a pleasure to visit and a nice break from the hustle and bustle of town. We spent only 2 hours there but you could easily wander around longer. Plenty of paths and open space, information boards etc. The Plant House and Orchid House were the favourites as they were of interests to us; with many similar plants in our home. Another big tick for this garden is the section where world leaders had planted a tree and we could see how much the tree has grown from then.... A recommended visit !

Quite possibly the biggest gardens I‚Äôve ever seen. Everything was beautiful and well maintained with some of the biggest plants I‚Äôve ever seen. Would definitely recommend using the restrooms at the entrance as there are not many modern restrooms once you enter the garden.
Her you can have a relaxed walk and see nice trees, plants but also bats and monkeys. There were many school children at the entrance but in the park there was sufficient space so it was not crowded

Impressive collection of Trees from all over the World. A pleasant afternoons' diversion from the mayhem of downtown Kandy. The tree collection is quite spectacular. The Orchid House the Rose Garden etc were a little disappointing. That said I have never seen such a range of tree specimens. The Palm avenue and the Giant Bamboo trees are awesome. Well worth a visit for a couple of hours. More interesting than Kandy itself

This is a very large, well maintained garden with lots to see as you wander around. You‚Äôll need at least a couple of hours for a quick tour. There is quite a bit of renovation going on so some places are closed. It costs 2000 rupees for foreigners to get in. Street vendors aren‚Äôt allowed in so your visit will be relaxed and hassle free. We didn‚Äôt visit at the best time of year in terms of flowers, but it was lovely nonetheless.

The rain didn‚Äôt spoilt our visit here, when we spent a few hours in these beautiful botanical gardens. Impressive orchids and awe inspiring trees and flowers. So many gardeners keep this place immaculate. But I will never forget the hundreds of huge fruit bats hanging in the trees! When they took to flight ... it was scary!

Beautiful site from start to finish. Unfortunately we could not get an electric car to tour the park, and did most of 63 acres of it on foot in 35 degree heat. However, the majestic trees provide much needed shade and it did not seem too strenuous after all. Many trees have been planted by dignitaries of times past, such as King George and Queen Mary of England in 1901. Queen Elizabeth II also visited twice, in 1954 and in 1981. We found the experience very fulfilling and learned about many previously unknown trees and plants. Monkeys add a funny aspect to the experience. Just mind you don‚Äôt leave your bag on the floor. Very good toilet facilities. Highly recommended.

Nice place to go to get away from the hustle and loudness of the city for a few hours.  Probably wouldn‚Äôt make a special trip there to go.  Beware of the scammers in the park who work there.  They will call you over and tell you to follow them to quiet part of the park tell you to look at the tree like they are an expert and then ask for money.  The first time we fell for it thinking this guy had something valid to tell us about the tree.  The second and third time just politely declined.  But all over the park we saw other tourists being conned in the same way.  Being led down the paths away from the main path.  Not only do you pay considerably more to get in than local people, you are then extorted by the workers once inside.  Beware

If you are in Kandy you must go to the Royal Garden, it's amazing, you can have a picnic in one of the parks, have a nice walk through the day and enjoy the shade with the breeze. Just one advise, in one of the paths, there are a lot of bats so be careful when you walk through that part or avoid it. They don't do anything but just in case you are afraid.
Nice place to spend a day. Better go when it is not too hot. A lot of things to do - can spend even whole day in there.
These gardens are a must see in Kandy - they are absolutely beautiful...the flying fox bats by the river were spectacular...

This is an excellent botanical site. I would suggest allowing a morning or afternoon to undertake a full visit. We benefited from a guide who could tell you about the various trees etc. A visit to the orchid house is a must.

Beautiful gardens, apart from amazing plants there are also monkeys and gigantic bats there! We spent about 3 hours wandering around but it'd be easy to spend an entire day there if one has the time. The entry fee is 2000 rupees for an adult and 1200 for a student and they honour student's cards from all over the world.
It is a beautiful place well worth going to. It is better to go first thing in the morning and see it without people, which then gets very crowded. There are all kinds of trees

These are very well organised and set up gardens. Some very interesting specimens, and thousands of flying foxes fruit bats (24 thousand apparently). There are regular small bus tours around the grounds which would be worth taking, or simply stroll around yourself.

This park is gorgeous! It's one of my favourite places in the world because it's extremely beautiful and very well-kept. Plus, if you enjoy being in contact with nature, I'm sure you will love spending some time here!

One of the main attractions in Kandy.  Entrance fees are 2000 Rps per person. If, like us your time is more limited you can hire a golf buggy for another 2000 Rps (although unfortunately you can't drive it yourself!!).  The guide will point out trees planted by various celebrities and royalty.  Although, I don't think this does the gardens justice and, in retrospect, would have preferred to wander through the pathways and enjoy them at a more sedate pace. As well as all the interesting trees, plants and orchids you can see monkeys and fruit bats.

If you really want to do full justice to this place you need 2-3 hours as it's a huge botanical garden with variety of trees, flowers and birds. The garden is well maintained and there's also a buggy service if you don't want to walk the entire garden area. What i loved most is the orchid garden, the cactii garden, the Rose garden, lovely trees in various natural shapes and the way different plants are laid to bring our the beauty.

There are plenty of nature‚Äôs delights here. Firstly, the trees are magnificent and there are so many different species, many are endemic. Secondly, you can see a number of colourful birds here. Thirdly, how about the huge red fruit bats that fill the trees in their hundreds! Not to mention the macaques which roam the gardens looking for scraps. There is also a very good cafe which has good value buffet food. If you need to get back to Kandy when your visit is over, and you are fed up haggling with tuktuk drivers, just jump on the bus and pay a few rupees (around 9 pence). Brilliant place.

Visited here on Jan 21st,2019. This garden is more floral than the Hakgala botanical gardens. Plenty of couples and white skinned foreign tourists here. You can also pay extra to sit in a buggy and see the place with live commentary and photo stops by the driver - which we did here. Since it is quite large if you plan on covering it by foot/walk then plan to easily spend at least 4 hours here.

a garden with a huge variety of plants, some not even available in other parts of the world.  a very enjoyable walk and the gardens even had an orchid flower house with different varieties of orchids.

This type of visit is generally not to my liking, so I was pleasantly surprised to have enjoyed it quite so much. It was included on our Tour itinerary, but I believe entry was about ¬£7 equivalent & well worth it. A tranquil place, despite the large number of visitors. We saw the fruit bats in flight, visited the Orchid house, saw the tree plaques with plantings by many famous personages etc. Our guide was very knowledgeable & this enhanced the trip. Depending on your level of interest, one could spend most of a day here.
The gardens are superb and great quiet place to relax. The gardens are very well cared for and we highly recommend a visit
WOW. What a place. Beauty everywhere. Superb arrangements. Nice walking experience. Bridge is a little bit adventurous too. Very soothing. We luckily had a very good weather as well.

This is a beautiful location to visit on a warm, sunny day. It is a moderately large park so one has the option of having a great walk but there is also a shuttle bus that moves from one important part of the park to another (at an added cost above and beyond the price of entry). There are many amazing sections including imported species of trees and flowers from other parts of SE Asia and even South America. The orchid building is wonderful to visit, albeit it a little hot and humid. There are a large number of bats in the trees as well as birds. A very peaceful place to visit after the intensity of the surrounding city.
A beautiful place to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle of Kandy... giant bamboo... lakes..monkeys and bats. So big it can‚Äôt really be crowded... calm and tranquil

Reviewer Location: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
Review Text: Tourism in Sri Lanka is being affected by a disappointing two-tier system that shows no respect for foreign visitors at attractions, 3000rs for foreigners and a fraction of the price for locals. This problem is reflected in the declining number of returning tourists. Despite having visited the country many times over the last 13 years with my Sri Lankan wife and her family, I have not seen any improvement in this situation, only a rise in costs. As someone who has visited many botanical gardens, I must say that this one is mediocre at best. The only highlight for me was watching the fruit bats.

I have visited the garden as a teenager many times while living in Sri Lanka. After more than 30 years living abroad, I decided to take my teenagers to show this amazing place. It is very disappointing that they charge more than $40usd while the locals pay less than $1. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this a very beautiful place but a steep cost for a family.

Wonderful gardens with all sorts of birds monkeys and large fruit bats. The tour in the golf buggy was wonderful and very welcome if you're a bit dodgy on your pins. The driver was also knowledgeable friendly and amusing. They don't have enough 3 seater buggies so you have to be lucky or pushy to get one. A pity they don't have more benches so that you can just and ponder. Lots of history.

it was a hot day but the gardens did not disappoint.  A favorite place for wedding photography we were lucky to see three separate brides and grooms in the short time we were there.  There is a lot to see and a lot we didn't realize was on site. It would pay to do a bit more research before you go so you make effective use of your time. Entrance fee of 1000 KLR pp cash only no credit cards accepted.  This is quite a cheap outing.

Beautifully kept, very well laid out gardens with many species of trees, plants, shrubs and grasses. Giant Bamboos, many varieties of palms, huge trees. Tree lined avenues and riverside walk. Nice way to enjoy 2hrs relaxing in the open air.

The entrance fee for tourists is 1500 rupee each, and they give you a map of the walks and locations of plants. There are free toilets, water points, and shops inside selling food and drinks so don‚Äôt panic if you aren‚Äôt prepared. The whole place is amazing and has such wide varieties of plants. You can get lovely photos like on Instagram at the palm tree walks and the large open green is great to sit in the shade part way through your walks and get your energy back for the rest. We leisurely walked around and stayed inside circa 2-3 hours, but if you were very interested I‚Äôm sure 4 hours would be plenty. There are TUK TUK drivers outside, as ours didn‚Äôt want to wait, but please note they will ask a premium to get back to Kandy but we just asked a few and one was wiki f to take us back for 300 rupee rather than 700.

The Botanical Gardens were very impressive in terms of content and scope.  A lovely way to spend a morning or afternoon.  Lovely bedding, impressive hot houses, especially the Orchid House and the Plant Room.  Everything was beautifully manicured.  Watch out for the giant palms and the giant bats!  Take your camera!

This garden serves as both a leisure park and a biological resource. It is popular but huge. It is located a short distance out of Kandy but travel is slow. It is largely open but there are areas of shade.  Plants are largely well labelled.  A good map is provided.  Polythene is not permitted Th Royal Palm walk is splendid but there are many other interesting features. The orchid house is interesting and colourful. Dont miss the Javanese figs with their huge roots. Dont miss the numerous fruit bats in the northern area.  There is quite a lot of birdlife too.
Excellently maintained gardens and Orchid House. Leisurely stroll around the stunning flora. Helps to have a knowledgeable guide but not a necessity. Must see when visiting the area.

large , well designed garden with beautiful collection trees and flowers. Especially the tree collection is impressing.I  couldn‚Äôt see everything as my driver was waiting. Most of all it is very very well kept. next best to me with the ¬´¬†jardins de pamplemousse¬†¬ª on Mauritius. tip : go urly in  the morning as it  gets stickier around noon

After the busy city centre we visited this beautiful botanical garden. It was so peaceful and quiet, we could relax. We enjoyed walking the exotic and special trees, plants and flowers. My favourite part was the orchid house. I think it‚Äôs a must-see site for nature-lovers.

My wife and I enjoyed a lovely casual stroll around the gardens on a sunny afternoon. The gardens are amazing with so many different species and variety of plans to see and admire. You can enjoy watching the monkeys play here too there are a lot of them around the trees and you can also see many flying squirrels here too. Well worth going here to chill and take a break.

We arrived early in the morning and were lucky to get a golf buggy and guide for an additional 1000rps. This helped us cover more than 5km of the beautiful gardens and ensured that we managed to see all the highlights within about an hour. Our guide was lovely! super friendly and informative and gave us good insight into the gardens history and fauna and flora. The entrance fee is 2000rps per person which is very reasonable considering the immaculate condition the garden is kept in. This is a must for nature lovers, photographers and artists!

Must visit place do take Electric car as lot of walk is involved as Shuttle is also available at good price but you have to wait for a long for availability ...and then we found wow... suspension bridge..orchid houses..flower garden.. etc

Peradeniya Botanical Garden is a must-visit for nature lovers. The sprawling grounds are filled with historical trees, stunning flowers, and inviting lawns. While the entry fee for foreigners (3000 LKR) is significantly higher than for locals (200 LKR), the experience is well worth it. Just be mindful of the monkeys that can be found in certain areas and take necessary precautions to avoid any unwanted encounters. Overall, Peradeniya Botanical Garden offers a peaceful and enchanting escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

This is a very nice botanical garden, with many beautiful flowers in the garden, and a great collection of orchids. There is a pleasant relaxed atmosphere, and we could easily have spent more time there.
Beautiful gardens and extensive grounds all immaculately kept .Easy to follow route around main sights and we particularly enjoyed the beautiful orchid house.
Nice botanical garden, but very expensive compared to the place. There is a price for locals and a price for foreigners.

A true oasis and escape from the businesses of the city. The gardens are well cared for a lovely way to while away around three hours in leafy greenness. Many notable and interesting plants and trees.

A lovely escape from the madness of Kandy, Highly recommended to visit. We spent 3 hours walking around the site. Plenty of shade, but if you can try and get there by 9am We liked, in particular the museum, the orchid house and the three avenues of pine, coconut and palm trees. The royal circle was interesting, checking out the many trees planted by dignitaries and royalty over the years. The herbal garden was disappointing and needs upgrading and the two cafes not great either. However we spent a good few hours checking out some amazing trees and flora and learning about the history of the gardens
Royal Botnical Gardens in Kandy is the most beautiful place in Sri Lanka. It appears you have entred a dreamland with beautiful flowers all around. A must visit during your Sri Lanka trip

Around 6km to the west of Kandy.  Overall these gardens are somewhat tired and neglected.  We have visited a number of botanical gardens around the world including in the tropics and these are typically free to enter or the entry price is reasonable.  The entry price for foreigners at Peradeniya is LKR2,000 per person, which is not far off what you would pay for far superior gardens in Europe.  I have no problem with foreigners being charged more than locals but the price charged should be reasonable and it would be good to see the money generated being invested in the site.

We loved the botanical gardens. It's beautiful, lots of open space as well as different themed houses. The orchid house was really nice. There's monkeys towards to back near the bamboo which were really cute to see. There's a little shop just outside for snacks and drinks. We spent 1.5 hours in the gardens but could have easily done longer. Lots of shaded areas to get out the sun.

Very nice botanical garden with beautiful and impressive trees and very nice layout. Just follow the numbers on the map for an excellent walk for several hours. Not so many plants to see and a few flowers this time of the year but still some very fantastic views and a lot of benches and spots just to sit and enjoy the scenery. Bring some food of your own for a picknick as the restaurant is below par compared to the beautiful surroundings.

Hi, Its located very hill country close to Kandy city. 100Km far from airport and nearly 3 hours direct driving. The large botanical garden with real relaxing with enjoyable visit. More Eco hotels,star class hotels , restaurants and shopping , religious and many more activities near was their.Half day can spend better in morning & evening . Also  Temple of Tooth ,Pinnawala Elipahant Orphanage & Kadugannawa crossing in additional location to cover same tour. Thanks.

I will begin by saying that I've been to more than my share of overpriced attractions in Asia. This garden, if you are a fan of gardens that is, is worth the 1500 LKR entrance fee. The place is absolutely huge, rubbish free, and very well maintained. I wandered around for 3 hours and could have spent longer there. I've certainly seen better collections of specific types of plants, but the overall collection on display here, and the overall feel of the place was special. One minor criticism - I would have loved to see an orchid display 10 times the size of what they currently have (think Singapore's garden). You know they grow here, let's show them off! The day I visited there were dozens of students on a school assignment mingling among the foreign visitors, engaging them in conversation as they practiced speaking English. It was refreshing to see their enthusiasm and I was more than happy to take time to chat with them.

Heaven on Earth. It is hard to imagine this wonderful place. 4000 trees from all over the world, 200 years old The vast expanse of trees are laid out over 60 hectares . See trees , orchids that you may have never seen before. A place where nature lovers like us can spend the whole day, away from noise and crowds. Neat and clean and the only sounds you hear are of birds. Next time we will spend a whole day here .

The botanical gardens are well worth a visit. Very well maintained grounds. You can take a buggy around however there is no English commentary. A few more English signs on the trees and plants would go over well.

The gardens are perfectly maintained, being Sunday they met so many families who played, couples walking. The park has trees from all over the world, monkeys, orchids, a small spice garden, many colorful flower beds and towards the bottom of the park a natural spectacle: thousands of flying foxes!! Absolutely recommended
We love nature and taking a walk, but the Royal Botanical Garden is a 5* experience. Words don‚Äôt describe well, so see pictures

Reviewer Name: kandy tuk tuk tours by munasingha
Review Text: Peradeniya Botanical Garden, a, is renowned for its extensive collection of flora and its stunning landscape.  very beautifully place

These gardens are offering countless species of local exotic flora. My favorite was royal palms, memorial trees and house of orchids but that is just a tiny part of what you can run into there. Reserve few hours and about about 1500lkr for this large area that is an ideal place for walks and relax.

Botanical Garden was the first attraction which we visited in our trip to Sri Lanka .our tour leader told about the garden history that every one knows about it and I dont want to repeat here . in fact the garden is beautiful and is a must seen in Sri Lanka , around two hour should be allocated for this attraction in your plan . there are wonderful landscapes for  memorable  photos . no doubt should be visited on sunny days . there are some kiosks inside to buy ice cream , water , fruit juice ,.... highly recommended to visit but take care of monkeys that may attack for food ,...
A great botanical garden. Many species unique to Sri Lanka. A nice place to stroll. It is quite large and provides a quiet space to get away from the noise and crowds of Kandy.

A lovely afternoon visit to the gardens. They are very spacious and have particularly interesting sections including the cycads, giant bamboo, cabbage palm Avenue and orchid house. Wish we had take a picnic, as the vibe would be perfect to sit and relax for an afternoon in the sun. There is a small cafe with a limited selection and clean toilets. Also a discount on entry to students (foreign).

They may not be the greatest gardens you'll ever see but as we had a morning to fill in, a nice long walk through the gardens was perfect before continuing on our road trip through Sri Lanka. For once we didn't have our heads buried in a guide book, we just roamed and discovered as we went, including a very nice cafe that made VG coffee. The gardens are big and nicely laid out, another legacy of the British Colonial era. The air was fresh, nice and cool in the morning and very relaxing.
Four of us enjoyed another visit to the excellent gardens but noted that, due to the current Covid-19 problems, the number of visitors were greatly reduced. This made our visit even more personal.

This is a really attractive large park in the town of Kandy, full of wonderful trees, shrubs and plants, many from different parts of the world. Entry is relatively cheap and I would suggest paying a little extra to tour the park with a driver on one of the electric buggies (it is very hot to walk around and explore the whole park - there's a lot to see and the drivers are quite knowledgeable). Most of the trees etc. have descriptive plaques, and you'll notice from the information that many were planted by famous people, some over a hundred years ago. In one area in some fir trees, you'll almost certainly see roosting bats, which was quite a surprise. The Royal Palm avenue is very nice too. Don't miss the Orchid House near the entrance before you leave. Very good.

As a seasoned tour guide with over a decade of experience in showcasing the best of Sri Lanka, the Peradeniya Botanical Garden remains one of my favorite places to take visitors. This sprawling garden, nestled near Kandy, is a haven for nature lovers and offers a unique glimpse into the island‚Äôs rich botanical heritage.

Went at 9am to avoid the crowds although the temperature was low 30's. Great shaded walkways. Well laid out, easy to follow on the given map. Tree signage brilliant with signage making you aware of the poisoness trees and who planted what. Don't miss it if you visit Kandy.

If you have limited time, I would recommend you get the electric buggy around the gardens, for a small extra charge (equivalent to about ¬£1 each).  It's a large site and you get to see a lot of it in the buggy. Other groups had their personal guides with them and got a lot more out of it than we did, as ours didn't come in with us.  But is was pleasant to be taken round and see the different types of flora and fauna.  We also saw the house where Lord Mountbatten stayed during part of the 2nd World War.

For us this was the highlight of our visit to Kandy.  The gardens are excellent.  Beautifully laid out, well documented and surprisingly peaceful. They compare very favourably with Kew and those in Madeira.  You do not need to be heavily into gardening or a botanist to enjoy these gardens - just relax and walk. One word of caution.  It can be very hot, though there is a lot of shade.  Take plenty of water, or, if the heat is problem, use the buggy for a guided tour.

One of our favourite stops during our visit to Sri Lanka, these historic gardens are impressive, and beautifully maintained. Featuring trees, plants and flowers from all over the world, it is a testament to the curiosity of British settlers who first established them (and the to sustained commitment of the Sri Lankan government to preserving the site. Lovely grounds to stroll, with many spots providing cooling shade to escape the often oppressive heat. We spent a few hours roaming, and saw perhaps half of the park. The orchid house is s highlight, as are the tree-lined pathways featuring particular species (double coconuts, royal palms, etc).

Plan 2-3 hours for your stay. Otherwise you'll either have to hurry or can't see everything. Can recommend the gift shop. The selection is quite good and the prices are low (e.g. 100-200 RS for a magnet).
So Green. Beautiful gardens. Instead of feeding squirrels we found ourselves spotting chipmunks and feeding monkeys! Great water features and plenty of plants (including giant bamboo) to get lost in.
I recently visited the Royal Botanical Gardens. What a great experience w. The gardens are extensive and was so relaxing to walk around.
Very nice gardens and very big, they have a lot of different species of plants and flowers. Also a chance to see a lot of birds and other animals. In the trees you can see hundreds of flying foxes

We went back and forth on whether to stop here on our way into Kandy, since we only had one night in the city and it's pretty hot to walk around the gardens in the middle of the day. In the end we did stop, and we're very glad we did. You don't need that long in Kandy, and Peradeniya was certainly more interesting than anything in Kandy. It takes 2 or 3 hours to wander around. There's a lot of great plants and trees, but also birds and a large number of bats towards the back of the gardens.
This botanical garden houses rare doule coconut trees, fragrant orchid collection, palm way and spice garden to name a few. We spent almost 3-4 hours at this spot.

I have visited the "Royal Botanical Garden" twice and like to see again and again. There are so many local plants, trees and foreign plants also. Very attractive place is the Orchid Garden, you can see so many Orchid flowers in it. I would like to thanks the staff of toilets cleaning, because they doing their job very well and so many cafes also are there. Recommended for full day or half day-outing trip here.
This about 3 miles west of Kandy. It has many plants  and many orchids and palm trees. The National Herbarium is attached. It goes back to  1371 under King Wickramananu

Great day out with my mum, was very peaceful and relaxing to walk around, the greenhouses were beautiful, however not many flowers were outside due to the time of year, so would defiantly come back in summer time to see the flowers. We booked last minute and got discount online so would defiantly recommend booking online! However the orangery restaurant was awful!!!! Would not recommend, floors were disgusting, food was over priced, waitresses looked unhappy, coffee from machine was disgusting and the doors were constantly being left open making it cold inside! So that‚Äôs the only bad thing I would say. Overall the gardens were beautiful.

An amazing place close to the bustling city. We spent 2 hours there, refreshing both mind and body. Beautiful plants and greenhouses. We fed little monkeys that run freely in the garden and enjoyed the shade of the trees. We walked through the entire park on foot, but saw that you can also rent golf carts.

For tourist who have visited similar parks in other parts of the world can avoid this.  The entry fee of LKR 2,000 for foreigners is not at all justified.  Its a waste of time and energy.  The only impressive part was the Orchid collection which had a few beautiful flowers.  The part is anyways well laid out and well kept.  You will find a lot of local couples romancing at secluded placed. If you do not get time to visit this location or avoid, you do not loose out on anything..  This is a very personal opinion.  Travelers who have lot of free time and money can definitely spend time here.  May be impressive for tourist from places with sparse vegetation.

We visited here yesterday. It was 1500 rupees each and well worth the money. We went in over a suspension bridge which was quite bouncy but there is another entrance if you are not keen on that idea. We felt we didn‚Äôt have enough time here as we were meeting our driver and could have happily stayed another couple of hours. There is a cafe and an ice cream place in the centre.

This is located close to Kandy and has a huge collection of trees. It is nicely laid out and has a lake in the center. There are trees from different parts of the world. The garden is well maintained and worth a visit.

If you like your botany with a side order of Colonial history, and movie trivia, Kandy Botanical Gardens will suit you down to the ground! These gardens, a former Royal Garden dating back to the 14th century, are beautifully laid out but not in an overly formal style. The British turned it into a Botanical Garden in the19th century. A highlight of the visit was a guided tour led by Mr Bandara Palipana, the lead academic for the gardens and author of numerous books on the gardens and the flora of Sri Lanka (he will happily sell you one from a bundle he carries around with him!). Mr Palipana, a distinguished,older gentleman, full of anecdotes, took us on a tour of superlatives, showing us the oldest, biggest, most poisonous, most important, most beautiful, most beneficial, trees and plants. He also regaled us with tales of Royal visits by HM Queen Elizabeth and Lord Mountbatten who lived in a bungalow in the grounds, and the garden's role in the movie 'Bridge Over The River Kwai'. All in all, an absolute treat!.

Slightly outside of Kandy with a not cheap entry price,especially for those that are accustomed to free access to parks, but well worth a visit. Wonderful place to while away several hours in a generally peaceful and interesting environment. There are lots of plants that were impressive (and a huge herd of bats) and that we‚Äôve not seen before, and also interesting installations. Bring water - it gets hot and only some parts have shade. Lots of picnickers too. There is a shuttle that goes around as the grounds are really large.

We decided to Visit the botanical gardens during our whistle stop tour of Kandy. We were not disappointed!! By far the best thing we did in Kandy. The gardens are a complete contrast to the busy city centre. Huge open spaces, very quiet and peaceful.... just don‚Äôt look up!!!!! About halfway through walking round/through the gardens, we looked up only to see 1000‚Äôs of bats the size of cats in the trees. Despite being harmless, it can be a little intimidating. Strongly recommend to anyone visiting Kandy. This has to be on your list of things to do.
Excellent gardens to walk around, beautiful flowers and lots of information on route. Try the suspension bridge if you have a head for heights and watch your bags with the cheeky wild monkeys

This botanical garden should not be missed on a tour of Sri Lanka. Such a amazing place and has wide varieties of plants. Well maintained. Air was fresh, nice and cool in the morning and very relaxing. A must do while you are in Kandy.
A must visit garden , stunning , personally I wouldn't wear flip flops like I did , trainers etc perfect, a quick tuk tuk ride from central kandy , 1500 rupees.
I loved this tranquil garden, The bats were my favorite. The gardens are 200years old and the trees amazing. I can truly recommend the botanical gardens.

Visited for an afternoon and was a very pleasant stroll through lovely grounds. Tourists pay 2000rupees and you can hire a golf cart for an extra 2000 if you feel too hot too walk. They have a fantastic selection of trees which are nice and shady to sit under and there is a lovely cool cafeteria where you can sit and have lunch and soft drinks at reasonable prices.

We only had an hour to enjoy this immaculate haven but we could have stayed for much longer. Every part of the garden was excellently kept. The highlights we found included the massive bamboo trees, the Orchid House and the Flower Garden. We were here around midday and found it to be very hot. I would recommend visiting at a cooler part of the day to really be able to take everything in.

What a total waste of space and time. The Orchid House and the Rose Garden were totally pointless and disappointing. The local Garden Centre in the UK has a better range of both Orchids and Roses. So we gave up and went to the cafe in the middle was a welcome spot to sit and have a drink. There are virtually no seats in the garden to look and relax.

We visited on a very hot day and there is not a lot of shade. Allow a couple of hours and go on the suspension bridge for photo. The orchid house is amazing there is such a variety of plants and trees. The fruit bats were interesting to see and we also saw lots of monkeys. Definitely needs to be on your itinerary when visiting Kandy.

This isn't my usual field of interest, but we enjoyed it so much. We hired a golf cart to take us around, and the driver was so knowledgeable and entertaining. It's a lovely way to spend a few hours in the shade and quiet. The garden is huge and so we'll maintained. I love seing the aquirels and fruitbats especially

We spent hours in this garden and if I had more time, I'd stay much longer. I loved this garden. It must have been the biggest I have been to in all my travels. The huge trees were extra special because of the history and their age. It is nice to find something like this at the heart of the city. Aside from plants, there are many animals roaming the garden so watch your belongings in case there are monkeys. They usually would not bother you but it's better to be sure. Wear comfortable footwear and clothes so you can cover the whole grounds.

Located about 10-15 kms away from kandy city. Its a huge botanical garden thats been developing from the last 100 years or so. Its beautiful and its huge. U can just keep walking for hours. Theres so much to observe here. Though i have no idea about trees/plants, it was quite fascinating to see the variety of flora n fauna. The botanical garden is really well maintained.  I found d entrance fee of 2000 LKR for foreigners too much though. Thats a big hole in d pocket. So if ur ok to spend on d entrance ticket then it‚Äôs surely worth a visit. We spent an hour n half just enjoying d greenery n pleasant weather.

This is a very nice and beautiful garden. It is a pretty large park so the best way to see it is by cart. This takes about an hour and cost is very little. Well worth the visit and a great way to fill in the day.

A quiet spot in Kandy, with hundreds of plants, trees ... and monkeys. Many Orchids in gorgeous colours. A great way to spend time is a slow stroll through the entire grounds. Nice to find a seat and just enjoy the beauty and quiet. Another must-do when in Kandy.
Beautiful gardens loved the orchids a truely peaceful place to spend some time . A lot of shady places to get out of the hot sun .
Very expensive to visit here in off season. Nothing much to see in the month of jan... And not worth...
These extensive gardens provide lush lawns on which children play, heaven in a crowded city. The maintenance and layout are quite good, but the plants and trees are not labeled which is a shame.

Needless to say it was a massive spread of various plants and trees from around the world. Well maintained and clean with information on some of them which we found to be useful. Many tourists around due to its popularity though it could never get congested. A huge grassland in the middle gave our kids unimaginable space to play. Alongside was a cafe where I could only spot tourists,the locals were seated down on the grass with their modest meals. We sat around them too and couldn‚Äôt have enough of the fresh air that is usually missing in gulf counties. At 2000 LKR per adult it was worth our time and effort.

Actually "Kandy" sounds so much nicer than it is, BUT: on our second day we visited the botanical garden and it was far beyond our expections. Its a huge areal to plan at least 3 hours for the visit. Surprised by amazing garden planning and well cared... One of the best botanical gardens I ever visited.

The garden includes many species of plants, This garden is home to trees from every corner of the tropical atmosphere.it's a massive garden and would take few hours for site seen. electric buggies were available, inside the garden average price cafeteria serving Western and Sri Lankan food for hungry tunnies. washroom facilities were available in many locations,  if you want to purchase plants, there is a plant centre near to the main gate ( Open at 0830 ). Barista and Laksala anchored near to exit.dont missed this man-made piece of art, it is a haven in the haven.

We were initially hesitant about a visit to the royal botanical gardens but overall it is a pleasant visit. We were focussing on a few displays that we were interested in. Firstly we went to see the giant bamboo forest which was amazing. We also went to take a look at the fig tree and the orchid house. It is well maintained but having more flowers would be good.

An unmissable visit, these gardens are a true marvel! They are located a few kilometers from Kandy, easily reachable by bus or tuk tuk. Entrance price 3000 rupees Huge park, where you can spend no less than 3 hours walking among hundreds of species of tropical plants. The pearl is the orchid greenhouse, where you can admire wonderful flowers.

Easy to spend a full afternoon here. Beautiful well kept gardens with lots of interesting trees and plants. There is an orchid house, suspension bridge and fruit bats along with cheeky monkeys who will take  food from your hand. But be warned, they can be slightly aggressive. The cafe is welcoming on a hot day.

This was by far the highlight of our stay in Kandy. The gardens are stunning and there are so many plants and trees to take in. We enjoyed watching the fruit bats hanging from the trees. If you don‚Äôt have much time I would recommend prioritising the gardens.

Royal Botanical Gardens are beautiful place with huge botanical diversity. You can walk along the paths here and admire different species of plants. This gardens have a large area so you can spend much time in this place and it isn't boring. Inside the gardens is really calm, you can relax, take a breathe and stay away from the noise of the city. Highly recommend!

I always visit botanical gardens whenever possible, this one gave me the most pleasure! A huge variety of plants, a well-thought-out path layout, all plants with captions. A real English garden! You can rent a golf car, which will help you explore the garden in comfort.
This tour really needs a buggy to get around but they don't have enough. had a very welcoming guide who took us to most of the 'important' places in the gardens

Peradeniya Botanic Gardens is a unique gift of Mother Nature with its ancient yet beautiful landscape.  This garden will be of great use to biologists, as it is home to a wide variety of species.  It is also a perfect place for family, friends or lovers to relax and unwind on the go with their children.  Even Tulu Latha brings helpful bliss. In particular, the garden is ready to capture your beautiful moments and create beautiful views by looking around throughout the garden. No matter how reluctant you are to leave again with the freedom you enjoy throughout the park, you will have to limit your leisure activities to 5 pm whenever you enter the park grounds.
Amazing trees and rare species. Good collection of orchids. Too bad we did not had a guide to explain the plants in the medicinal garden. Restaurant is very good. I recommand it.

A rally lovely & relaxing place to visit with many areas to enjoy throughout the gardens, some fabulous views to enjoy. A lot of history too, to absorb. The variety & care taken for the upkeep is first rate. Ensure you allow yourself the time to properly enjoy this place. Views from the suspension bridge are fantastic as well as interesting engineering construction.

These botanical gardens are so pretty. You just cant stop admiring nature. But the weather these days is so so hot. It ruins your trip. Better to take a buggy ride all around the park, else you might not be able to cover it all. Start late in noon so its some nice stroll. The bamboo plantation is just mesmerizing. Some very old trees, some trees planted by royal guests, spices trees area and a suspended bridge are some highlights where you should stop. P.s i was so amazed to find really clean restrooms!
Overall a wonderful experience.  Calm and serene, this garden shows some amazing plants, trees, and flowers.  The orchid garden was particularly beautiful.
Tip - use a buggy for covering this in an hour. Very well maintained botanic garden. Entry fees is on the higher side but still highly recommended to visit
Approx 20 mins outside Kandy (very busy roads) this is a real treat for those who love gardens, trees, flowers and history.

We went to the Botanical Garden a few days ago. We arrived at 8am before it got hot and crowded. We went on an hours buggy ride round the garden which was great as we were shown the main areas and special plants and then we were able to go back to the areas we wanted to see again. The orchid house was lovely and not to be missed.

Review Title: Explore the spectacular plant life of Sri Lanka
Review Text: This massive garden was a joy to explore on a hot day as it was much cooler under the trees. There's a nice children education center that includes a whimsical maze area including a bunny hedgehog and more. Plan to spend time here.
When you are in Kandy, you should definitely visit the gardens. You can easily spend a couple of hours there and see the amazing collection of trees, plants, etc. The kids also loved it!

I had been really looking forward to visiting here and it did not disappoint! Beautiful trees, flowers, gardens, orchids and lots of opportunity to spot wildlife and birds. We arrived morning and walked anti- clockwise and found it very quiet as most people seemed to be going clockwise, I especially loved the walk down cabbage patch lane. Highly recommend a visit but take plenty of water, it is very hot!

Located in Peradeniya, just 5.5km to the west of the city of Kandy and is renowned for its collection of orchids. The garden is home to more than 4000 species of plants, spices, medicinal plants and palm trees. You can explore the grounds on foot, however, if you‚Äôre feeling tired, or potentially lazy, golf carts can be rented. It costs 1500 LKR/person to enter the gardens. A perfect place to relax and take some great pictures, we spent about 2 hours here and went early in the morning to avoid crowds of people.

You will need at least three hours in these gardens (we only managed to see about half). If you go right after you have entered visit the Orchid House and go further walking alongside the river look up to see the fruit bats. So many examples of trees, bamboos and palms, highly recommend a visit.

This is Sri Lanka's main botanical gardens; as such we expected more (especially having see the equivalent in other Asian countries such as Singapore). Sri Lanka has a vast range of "exotic" plants native to the country - thus you would expect the botanical gardens to display them to the full - put simply, it doesn't. Well worth visiting, and well looked after.

This place is amazing! I love plants and animals and visiting the beautiful gardens was perfect for me and my husband! You can see a lot of flowers, many types of trees from different parts of the world, friendly monkeys, big bats in the trees and many more. We also loved the orchid house. At the end of our visit, we stopped to the souvenir shop and bought incense sticks and some other local goods for our family and friends.

The glowing reviews of the Botanical Garden baffle me.  Yes, it‚Äôs beautifully laid out, but labeling is miserable.  Upon entry, paying the massive foreigners‚Äô fee ‚Äì as if we‚Äôre some sort of different animal from Sri Lankans ‚Äì visitors are given a map with such tiny print that it‚Äôs almost impossible to see.  The roads/paths aren‚Äôt marked on the map, and there‚Äôs no indication of the location of the flora featured on the pages adjacent to the map.  Some plants are labeled; most are not.  And the labels are pretty useless.  A large plot of dahlias, for example, are simply described as dahlias, no indication of the specific cross or the name of each plant.  It‚Äôs even worse in the orchid house, where the labels that would indicate the cross of the orchids, even the species name, are neatly hidden, and visitors are specifically admonished not to touch the plant labels.  So in the end the Botanical Garden offers a lovely stroll in an otherwise crowded city, but informative it most certainly is not.

Lovely place to visit.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that my partner, one of the worlds leading agricultural crop plant pathologists, was very keen to visit the wild relatives of modern crops area.  Unfortunately, although this area is on the map it has been removed.  Aside from that a lovely place to spend a few hours.  The suspension bridge is not for the feint hearted!

We loved walking through these gardens. They are beautifully landscaped with more than 4000 species of plants. They have a big collection of orchids too. The cannon ball tree was very fascinating. One can easily spend a couple of hours here without getting bored. But you have to be prepared to walk. The gardens are spread over a huge area.
