A really nice thing, I will say something that I already said about the ticket prices very finely, they are real thieves... then they will be surprised that they don't have tourists, then stop stealing... damn... ...this place is spectacular, it is wonderful, you can get lost for hours, plants of all kinds, trees, gardens, flowers... etc...
Very well maintained gardens with beautiful flowers and trees.  A very pleasant afternoons walk around this large estate,

Loved this wonderful place. Best thing of all was the golf cart we rented to get around as it was punishingly hot. The guide was knowledgeable and pointed out trees planted by notable people. The orchid house was the highlight but we also liked the three palm lined avenues and the lake. It was so quiet and calm here.

We easily got a tuk tuk from our hotel to take us to the gardens. Entry fee is about $15 CDN each person. There is a coffee/gift shop at what is the entrance and the exit area. Public washrooms, which are very clean, are at the entrance and throughout the gardens. Can easily cover the gardens in 3 hours or less depending on what you wish to see and how fast you walk. Well maintained and a treat for any nature lover. We also saw a troop of monkeys and many beautiful birds.
Get out of the noise and madness of the city and spend a wonderful couple of hours wandering these lovely gardens. Stunning flowers, awesome giant bamboo and the orchids are breathtaking.

They are located just outside Kandy, in Peradenya, but with the chaotic traffic of the city it takes a while to arrive. They are very interesting if you have a guide who explains the different types of trees and plants. The greenhouse with the orchids and the avenues of Coco de Mer are wonderful. You can spend a couple of hours there in peace

We stopped at the botanical gardens after visiting the Temple of the Tooth and it was a lovely way to end the day. The gardens are extensive so be prepared for a lot of walking (in the heat!)! Our guide arranged for a tour of the gardens for us and it was great, we got to see the whole area and the different varieties of plants, learn a little about the history of the gardens, and all without breaking a sweat! Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

Large botanical gardens that are doing great work alongside Kew gardens amongst others. Some great tree species to see from around the world , as well as beautiful flowering plants. Loved the avenue of palms, the large , old mahogony tree and the Madagascan 'canon ball tree' with its beautiful fruits shaped like cannon balls and its beautiful flowers. Well laid out, well sign posted and very well maintained. You will probably need 3 hours plus to see it all. Although there is shade , it was hot walking around so take plenty of water. There is a cafe , ideally located by the large lawn if you want to stay longer/ are in need of refreshments.
Botanical Gardens outside Kandy. Not very well looked after, very large and with lots of plants. Worth a visit if you have time to spare.

Not normally my cup of tea but everyone spoke to recommended it after a long drive and visit to the tooth temple and tbh I wasn‚Äôt disappointed! Very well kept vast gardens with many points of interest and some beautiful floral arrangements !

FABULOUS. I had a great few hours here. Amazing. The trees etc were spectacular. The cheeky monkeys roaming around watching for an opportunity. Magical place. Well worth a visit. Very well maintained. Sch a variety of things to see. Camera fanatics would love this.

Great verity of trees, plants and flowers. I could see acres and acres of greenery.  It takes at least a day to see it all. Nice place to relax. Nice place to picnic and enjoy the nature. Nicely kept garden with lost of space. Ideal to take photos. Enjoyed the green houses with verity of cactus, orchids, roses, tropical flowers and ornamental plants. Could see some birds, butterflies and lots of big bats. The Mahavali River runs along side of it giving some vibrancy. Away from the busy town life and noise. Less crowded when I visited and couldn't see any foreign tourists. Could see many rear plants.

We visited late in the day and foot sore from earlier excursions so took a buggy with a knowledgeable driver,which was not very expensive.  A vast range of plants and trees in well organised sections, well worth a visit to experience another side of the busy city.
The garden is impressive due to its size and diversity of the plants and in particular the tree-vellum fold. Definitely a place to relax and to be amazed.
There are so many varieties of beautiful plants, flowers and spices. Having the monkeys around makes the experience even better. Highly Recommended.

These gardens are definitely worth a visit. We spent 6 hours there, and could have spent longer. Great value for money, but regardless of that, there was so much to see, in these immaculately well kept gardens, which were easy to wander around, and a total joy to absorb oneself in. There was a vast array of plants and trees, ferns and spices, and a suspension bridge well worth walking over!. The gardens are set alongside the river, which made for a stunning setting. We travelled by tuk tuk each way which made the entire experience superb and unforgettable.

The gardens are very well looked after and are beautiful. The fruit bats in the trees were great to watch. the range of species was vast and the whole gardens very well planned. There is a super grass area which local school children were using. There is a good cafe/restaurant and plenty of clean toilets. A really good day out.

Review Title: Still a great garden to explore
Review Text: Lots to explore and wander on your own paths. We went on a sunday so it was a little crowded but it's still possible to find space on your own amongst the beautiful trees. Its well signposted and you can pick where you want to roam. The only place that was disappointing was the conservatory - seemed neglected and plants were not at all exciting.

We spend a couple of hours here at the end of our day that started in Dambulla and ended in Kandy, and they were a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hours. If we hadn't told our driver to come back in two hours we might have stayed a little longer, but I think we saw most of the highlights. The orchids are of course fabulous, but to me the most impressive were the tress with plaques showing who had planted them and one. I must say the future Czar Nicholas II did a great job, as did Edward VII while Prince of Wales. You wouldn't miss a great deal by skipping the suspension bridge My one regret was that we were too early to see the flying foxes, and I failed to find the trees they were roosting in. You wouldn't think 24,000 of them could hide so well Lots of rather sweet young local couple walking round holding hands

recently visited the Royal Botanical Gardens in Kandy and it was a beautiful walk. The cost of entry is 3000 Sri Lankan rupees per adult, and children under 5 or 6 do not pay, which is very advantageous for families (price for foreigners). Despite a rainy day, I really enjoyed the visit. We took a Golf Cart for 7 people, which costs 2000 Sri Lankan rupees for an hour tour. This proved to be more than enough to enjoy the gardens without tiring

These gardens were a highlight of our time in candy. The gardens where a peaceful haven from a bustling city centre. There were many distinct areas and a huge variety of different types of trees. We could‚Äôve spent hours and hours there

This is a beautiful garden and a welcome haven from the busy centre of Kandy. There are so many interesting and unusual plants and it is a real joy to wander around for a few hours - I definitely recommend visiting if you are in or near Kandy. The photos on here and elsewhere online didn‚Äôt really do it justice, it is more impressive in real life!

One of the nicest green spaces i've ever experienced Just a quick glance at all the trip advisor reviews on here and its obvious the botanical gardens are popular and highly rated. I can only add weight to that and say that we thoroughly enjoyed spending an afternoon here, though you could spend a full day if you had the time. We were contemplating just having a rest day round the pool at the hotel but decided to make the journey here and we were SO glad we did. Other places should look to this place as an example of a well thought out, maintained and looked after urban green space. It contains a bewildering variety of plants and trees, giant fruit bats hanging from and flying between the trees, monkeys you can get right up close to, lakes, and an orchid house with some of the most amazing flowers. There is a cafe / buffet restaurant in the park, but this would make a lovely place to bring a picnic. If you appreciate and enjoy nature and green spaces then this is a must visit if staying in or near Kandy. It is approx. 15 mins from Kandy city to here by tuk tuk and the fare should cost about 5 GBP. If you have already been on a tuk tuk with a mad driver then you will understand what an 'experience' this is, and if you haven't then do try to experience this at least once in your travels !

Its is a huge botanical garden in the middle of Kandy city. Those with an inclination towards plant studies will have a great time exploring the garden as it has a lot of variety of plantation. We loved the greenery and beautiful flower garden. To my surprise we have seen a double coconut tree inside the garden and same dried one is for display in a museum inside premises. You can spend entire day if you wish to in a calm and beautiful garden. Please note it has an entry fee. I'll suggest to improve on the direction maps so people can explore their interest due to limited time being a tourist.

200 year old royal botanic garden with a huge variety of flora and fauna to see.  TIPS: thousands of bats live on the island, so if you are lucky (or loom long enough, you will definitely see and hear them. unique experience. I would suggest to plan 1.5 hrs. Garden tours on electric gold vehicles are also on offer for those who cant walk long
Nice place for walking and for those who are addicted to the nature. We spend 3 hours there and the place was amazing

I am not usually a botanical gardens fan, but our innkeeper and many guide books recommended this, so we decided to give it a try (especially since it was Monday and the Tea Museum was closed).  What a pleasant surprise!  The various avenues of palms are striking and you can enjoy many areas of shade as you explore the grounds.  The gift shop is excellent as well. You could easily spend hours here, but 90 minutes was enough for us. Enjoy!

Extensive botanical gardens which seem well frequented by Sri Lankans. While covering a significant area, this is not as impressive as Botanical Gardens in other global locations (and probably influenced a lot by climate). We visited as part of a Sri Lanka Tour (and to pass time before something else).

The botanical gardens are the largest in Sri Lanka, with huge areas of green well kept lawns. There are many different aspects to the gardens which contain specific sections such as orchids, rubber trees, the palm avenue to name a few. Giant fruit bats hang in the trees and fly screeching overhead. There's more than enough to keep you here for a few hours.

It is indeed a nice botanical garden to spend hours. The garden has wide space and plenty to enjoy. It well maintained. Different section of the garden fills heart with different types of feeling. A must visit place.
You must see this place when you go to kandy , amazing, wonderful place and it was one of the places i really like, big trees with alot of roots, all kinds of tree.
